abstract: Study published online by journal Cell Host and Microbes finds that a vaginal gel that sharply reduces a woman's risk of infection with the AIDS virus is even more effective against genital herpes, a much more common risk for young American women.
snippet: A vaginal gel that sharply reduces the risk of H.I.V. infection was found to be even more useful against genital herpes.
lead_paragraph: A vaginal gel that sharply reduces the risk of H.I.V. infection was found to be even more useful against genital herpes.

headline.main: Gel Cuts Women’s Risk of Herpes, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Gel Cuts Risk of Herpes Among Women, a Study Finds
headline.seo: Gel Cuts Herpes Risk in Women, Study Finds
